concept.title: Rescue Equipment

audience.otherprops: maintenance personnel, safety officers, procurement, rescue team members

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Specifies rescue equipment types, inspection requirements, maintenance and storage guidance for working at heights operations.

othermeta.name: taxonomy

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: define rescue equipment requirements and inspection regimes

ol.li: Depending on the type of work that is carried out, as well as the height of the building/room or site specific circumstances, you might need to use rescue equipment as simple as a ladder or as complicated as a crane. In some situations, you may have to consider MEWPs (mobile elevating work platforms), man-riding baskets for cranes or proprietary rescue systems.
In any case, ensure that the equipment that you will use for a rescue are properly serviced before being put to use. Do not use the equipment for purposes other than which it was intended.
All the rescue equipment shall be inspected at least once a year by competent person.
The site will also need to keep records of previous inspections, maintenance and equipment history.
